thread.title: Carrot River Co-op picked to run private liquor store - Saskatoon | Globalnews.ca
thread.title_full: Carrot River Co-op picked to run private liquor store - Saskatoon | Globalnews.ca

author: David Giles
title: Carrot River Co-op picked to run private liquor store - Saskatoon | Globalnews.ca
text:
Saskatoon teens discourage impaired driving on SLGA liquor bags 
Carrot River Inn had originally been chosen to operate the liquor store, but that was cancelled after it came to light that Saskatchewan Party MLA Fred Bradshaw held a small ownership in the company. 
Although Bradshaw stated he was not involved in the management of the business nor involved in the decision making process for the permit, the permit was cancelled. 
KPMG provide oversight in the selections process. 
SLGA officials said the RFP process for 50 new private liquor stores is now concluded, with 39 existing SLGA stores being converted along with 11 new stores. Â© 2017 Global News, a division of Corus Entertainment Inc.
